articles.headline: Suspected Leader of 9/11 Attacks Is Said to Confess
articles.snippet: “I was responsible for the 9/11 operation, from A to Z,” Khalid Shaikh Mohammed said, according to a Pentagon transcript.
articles.abstract: “I was responsible for the 9/11 operation, from A to Z,” Khalid Shaikh Mohammed said, according to a Pentagon transcript.
articles.lead_paragraph: Khalid Shaikh Mohammed, long said to be the mastermind of the Sept. 11 attacks, confessed to them at a military hearing held in Guantánamo Bay, Cuba, on Saturday, according to a transcript released by the Pentagon yesterday. He also acknowledged full or partial responsibility for more than 30 other terror attacks or plots.

articles.headline: Loan Unit Drags Down H&R Block
articles.snippet: While H&R Block’s tax business is showing signs of improvement, it cannot get rid of its subprime mortgage group, Option One, fast enough.
articles.abstract: While H&R Block’s tax business is showing signs of improvement, it cannot get rid of its subprime mortgage group, Option One, fast enough.
articles.lead_paragraph: Just a few years ago, the tax-preparation giant H&R Block was making as much money from offering home loans to individuals with risky credit as it was preparing tax returns for millions of Americans.

articles.headline: One Number That Will Ring All Your Phones
articles.snippet: A new service called GrandCentral can unify your cellphone with phones at work and home and perform many other tricks.
articles.abstract: A new service called GrandCentral can unify your cellphone with phones at work and home and perform many other tricks.
articles.lead_paragraph: If you have only one telephone with one phone number, this column won’t be of any interest to you. Skip to another article, you eccentric you.

articles.headline: Playing Hunches at Harvard
articles.snippet: Mohamed El-Erian, head of the $30 billion Harvard Endowment, has brought an international flair and bond expertise to the job.
articles.abstract: Mohamed El-Erian, head of the $30 billion Harvard Endowment, has brought an international flair and bond expertise to the job.
articles.lead_paragraph: In mid-January, Mohamed El-Erian, head of the $30 billion Harvard Endowment, made a $1.6 billion bet that markets around the world were overvalued, and he sold off stocks representing 5 percent of Harvard’s total portfolio.

articles.headline: Wal-Mart Is Said to Have Big Banking Plans
articles.snippet: Wal-Mart’s ambitions into consumer banking may extend beyond what the retail giant had previously disclosed.
articles.abstract: Wal-Mart’s ambitions into consumer banking may extend beyond what the retail giant had previously disclosed.
articles.lead_paragraph: An Ohio representative is planning to release information today that suggests Wal-Mart’s ambitions into consumer banking may extend beyond what the retail giant had previously disclosed.

articles.headline: Charges Dismissed in Hewlett-Packard Spying Case
articles.snippet: A judge dropped charges against the former chairwoman of Hewlett-Packard, Patricia C. Dunn, who was accused of fraud in a boardroom spying scheme.
articles.abstract: A judge dropped charges against the former chairwoman of Hewlett-Packard, Patricia C. Dunn, who was accused of fraud in a boardroom spying scheme.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO, March 14 — A California judge on Wednesday dismissed charges against Patricia C. Dunn, the former chairwoman of Hewlett-Packard, in a corporate spying case that gained national attention and prompted Congressional hearings on the protection of personal telephone records.
